name: Portfolio
title: New Portfolio
objective: Rebuild my portfolio in React and highlight coding projects
skills: React, Node, JSON, CSS, Javascript, CSS
challenges: There are some things I'm still learning to do with React.
takeaways: As I continue to learn, I will add features like modals, accordions, and filters. I think once I learn Hooks and/or Redux I will be able to do more. Also, I made this easier by using JSON instead of a database.

name: reportTracker
title: Report Tracker
objective: Members of an organization log in and submit reports.
role: Everything. Full stack (database, routing, apis, front-end, logo
challenges: Passport authentication. I changed this from a React - Mongo app to a React - Sequelize app, and then I realized that I just wanted to get the routing and database to work, so I simplified it to an HTML5 site.
takeaways: I will build this again in React and then React Native.

name: SpacexLaunchPad
title: Spacex Launch Pad
objective: Alerts users to times of future Spacex launches.
role: Group project with Ben Houston and Dave Hiller. I did front-end and the API for future launches.
challenges: When we did this project, I was not yet comfortable with Git but managed to use it.
takeaways: It's cool to work on a project that you can actually use!

name: Project 2
title: Project 2
objective: Website that gathers data from users
role: My role was Front-end and html routing. Jianhong Weng did the database and API routing. Hitomi Barnes researched AWS. Max Rosen came up with the concept and verbiage.
skills: Routing, Javascript, HTML5, CSS, Bootstrap 4, Git
challenges: My biggest challenge was learning to write code for routing.
takeaways: I'm more comfortable with Git and routing.
